Good evening middle and high school families,

We are about to enter our first full week of remote learning. The first two days had a few bumps and hiccups, but we managed to work through most of them.

Take a few minutes this evening to look at your student's Zoom schedule for tomorrow. These Zoom meetings are required and can be joined by computer or phone. Be sure to discuss joining options with your student's teachers if you are experiencing connectivity issues.

There are two other sites that will be important as we progress through this period of remote learning. First, check in with your student that they are completing their assignments in Odysseyware. Then, check your child's grade in Alma to see how they are doing. It is also helpful to check attendance in Alma since attendance is maintained by your student's daily activity in completing assignments and joining Zoom class sessions.

We are all navigating this new road together and are excited about the opportunities that lie ahead of us. Go Rams!

Good afternoon Centennial elementary families!

This Monday and Tuesday, all traditional students from Cohort A come to campus to begin their year. They will be on campus for two days to get their computers, meet their teachers, and get used to the online platforms we will use during remote learning.

There will be an informational meeting for elementary parents in Zoom on Tuesday 6:00 to help you better understand remote learning for your child. You can join this meeting by computer or phone. Information about how to join will be sent out on Tuesday at 5:30.

We look forward to a great a week of learning!

South Conejos School District
May 29 at 10:02 AM ·

http://southconejos.com/summer-online-learning/

The South Conejos School District is proud to announce that our Summer Online Learning program is open to anyone that wants to participate. Our live online classes are aimed at students ages 2-18, but there is something for everyone. We are offering English and Spanish storytime, a book club for tweens, and (wait for it) a slime making class! You can learn how to be a film critic, manners, archeology, and parents we will even teach kids how to clean a messy bedroom. Click on the registration links on the schedule and we can’t wait to see you there!

Please like, comment, and share with anyone that loves learning as much as we do at Antonito Schools. If you are currently enrolled in one of our schools, we can set you up with the technology that you need to take online classes this summer. Please email Zach at zdeherrera@southconejos.com. Thank you and have a great Trojan day!
